intro: Herpetospermum tonglense, commonly known as the Chinese starfruit tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and culinary uses, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical gardens.
